title.narrative: Emergency Support to Safeguard Food Security and Livelihoods for Most Vulnerable Farming Households in Kayin and Shan (South) States.

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide life-saving [sector] assistance to vulnerable communities in Kayin and Shan. This FAO project provides seeds, fertilizer and training to farmer households. The project provides life-saving assistance to 15,000 people, including 5,341 women, 4,295 men, 5,364 children, and 1,047 persons with disabilities.

participating-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Emergency Support to Safeguard Food Security and Livelihoods for Most Vulnerable Farming Households in Kayin and Shan (South) States.

receiver-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Provision of cereal seeds and fertilizers to support winter crop production provided to improve agriculture livelihoods and food security of 15,000 people living in 3,000 vulnerable farming households.
AP.5b Percentage of affected people who state that they were able to access humanitarian assistance and services in a safe, accessible, accountable and participatory manner
Ag.1 Number of people benefiting from agricultural inputs support production packages)

Ag.6 Number of people receiving training on agricultural skills, practices and/or technologies (vulnerable farming people provided with quick awareness orientation and good agriculture practices and nutrition leaflets as part of the cereal production package assistance)
FS.2 Percentage of households who report being able to meet the basic needs of their households according to their priorities
